meanings.definition: The inability to walk due to a loss of muscle control or coordination.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he developed abasias and could no longer walk.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with abasias, explaining why she struggled to move her legs.
meanings.sent3: Despite his abasias, he tried to dance at the party, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her abasias felt like invisible chains, holding her back from exploring the world.
meanings.sent5: The image of abasias haunted her dreams, a constant reminder of her physical limitations.
